com.mobilerq.android.sdk

Class MrqEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mobilerq.android.sdk.MrqEvent

  • public class MrqEvent
extends Object

    An event that is relevant to the customer. Events must have a type and a start time. Two MrqEventTypes are support; FLIGHT and HOTEL. Events have properties. Properties can be targeted or used as content variables. Some properties are special and, when sent, allow MobileRQ to enhance the event.

    Flight Events

    Start and end are flight departure and arrival times. Location and address are ignored for flights

    Flight events support the following special properties:

    KeyValue
    airlineThe IATA carrier code portion of the flight code
    flightNumberThe numeric portion of a flight code
    originAirportThe IATA code assigned to origin airport
    destinationAirportThe IATA code assigned to destination airport
    checkedIntrue or false depending on check-in status

    Sending the start, end, airline, flightNumber, originAirport, and destinationAirport of a flight allows MobileRQ to lookup flight status, estimated, and actual flight times. Additionally, MobileRQ will lookup the originAirport and destinationAirport name, location and time zone. These can targeted or used as content variables. Send checkedIn to target on reservation check-in status.

    Hotel Events

    Start and end are reservation check-in and checkout times. Location is the hotel property location. Address is ignored.

    Hotel events support the following special properties:

    KeyValue
    nameThe full name of the hotel property
    checkedIntrue or false depending on check-in status
    checkedOuttrue or false depending on checkout status

    Start, end, location, checkedIn, checkedOut can targeted or used as content variables.
